item.title: hamid add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: hamid add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: hamid add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: hamid add a quote by Mikhail Bulgakov
item.description: "You're not Dostoevsky,' said the citizeness, who was getting muddled by Koroviev. Well, who knows, who knows,' he replied. 'Dostoevsky's dead,' said the citizeness, but somehow not very confidently. 'I protest!' Behemoth exclaimed hotly. 'Dostoevsky is immortal!" -- Mikhail Bulgakov

item.title: hamid add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "Remember: the time you feel lonely is the time you most need to be by yourself. Life's cruelest irony." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: hamid add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "â€ŽLife is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: hamid add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means..." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: hamid add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "She was ready to deny the existence of space and time rather than admit that love might not be eternal." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: hamid add a quote by Alan Watts
item.description: "Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth." -- Alan Watts

item.title: hamid add a quote by Irvin D. Yalom
item.description: "What? 'Borderline patients play games'? That what you said? Ernest, you'll never be a real therapist if you think like that. That's exactly what I meant earlier when I talked about the dangers of diagnosis. There are borderlines and there are borderlines. Labels do violence to people. You can't treat the label; you have to treat the person behind the label. (17)" -- Irvin D. Yalom
